p: Concerning the chemical composition of the volatile fraction, the EOs from other species of genus Siparuna were mainly based on sesquiterpenes: S. aspera and S. macrotepala presented as major compounds germacrene D (23.2%, 42.1%), bicyclogermacrene (7.8%, 11.8%), and α-pinene (7.0%, 1.8%) [ 34], while in the essential oil of S. eggersii the principal components were epicurzerenone (29.9%), germacrone (10.5%), and caryophyllene oxide (29.0%) [ 23]. On the other hand, our EO was mainly composed of monoterpenes, with α-pinene (24.3%), β-pinene (21.7%), β-myrcene (11.3), and limonene (10.0%) being major constituents.
